title: Gal Gadot turns heads in asymmetric mini-dress with a thigh-high slit at Louis Vuitton store launch
text:
She is a major name in Hollywood and is set to lead the second installment of Wonder Woman in 2020.

And Gal Gadot was on A-list form as she turned heads at the star-studded re-opening of Louis Vuitton's New Bond Street store in central London on Wednesday night.

The actress, 34, looked stylish as she dazzled on the red carpet in an asymmetric mini-dress with a revealing thigh-high slit.

Glamorous: Gal Gadot was on A-list form as she turned heads at the star-studded re-opening of Louis Vuitton's New Bond Street store in central London on Wednesday night

The screen star paired her look with a pair of laced-up studded boots, while a light palette of make-up enhanced her glowing features.

The mother-of-two accessorised with pendant earrings and wore her raven locks scraped back from her face in a stylish up-do.

The actress joined a host of other stars at the event, including former Oasis rocker Noel Gallagher, 52, and his wife Sara MacDonald, 47, models Poppy Delevingne, 33, and Alexa Chung, 35, and DJ Nick Grimshaw, 35.

Gal's outing comes after she launched her own production company earlier this month.

Chic: The actress, 34, looked stylish as she dazzled on the red carpet in an asymmetric mini-dress with a revealing thigh-high slit

The Wonder Woman star has teamed up with husband Jaron Varsano - who she has been married to since 2008 and shares two daughters, Alma, seven, and Maya, two, with - to form Pilot Wave.

'Pilot Wave is taking off! I'm so excited this is finally out,' she announced on her Instagram account.

'@jaronvarsano and I have been working on this for quite some time and I just CAN'T wait to bring to life all the amazing stories we're working on with all our talented partners.'

She added: 'As producers, we want to help bring stories that have inspired us to life. Pilot Wave will create content that promotes the perspectives and experiences of unique people and produce impactful stories aimed at igniting the imagination.'

The first project from Pilot Wave will be historical thriller Irena Sendler, in which Gal will play the titular character and she and Jaron will produce alongside Marc Platt.

Talented! The star;s outing comes after she launched her own production company earlier this month with husband and producing partner Jaron Varsano (pictured in March)

Irena Sendler tells the story of a woman's defiant stand against Nazi Germany's occupation of Poland and how she saved 2,500 Jewish children from the Warsaw ghetto.

Following her arrest by the Gestapo, the drama becomes a race against time to save not only herself but the identities of those she has protected.

The actress will be seen reprising her role as superhero Diana Prince in Wonder Woman 1984.

The blockbuster is the sequel to 2017's Wonder Woman will also star Pedro Pascal, Chris Pine and Kristen Wiig and is scheduled for release in June 2020.

Gal will also appear in Sir Kenneth Branagh's adaption of Death On The Nile and will feature in Red Notice on Netflix alongside Dwayne Johnson and Ryan Reynolds.
